1uOt1VvQdMoZdKbh7s4VNw.text: Come for the cow, leave for the hipsters. Actually we came for the dessert, but did have a conversation about where we could purchase a cow, stuff and then set in formaldehyde. Fortunately one of our party knew a taxidermist so we were halfway there. After failing to get in for dinner, we came back to experience the place and check it out for more organised nights in the future. As it was the end of the night, the service was far from stellar. A bit distracted. Fortunately the kitchen was still awake and we ate a delicious warm blackberry pie and custard. I'm not sure how I'll feel about dinner there, you have to pay 40 quid to get a decent sized piece of steak and the roast chicken looked a tad greasy. Plus the place was overrrun in hipsters. A blight on society ;-)My advice: book in advance! And the chocolate and blackberry ice cream is to die for.

70IbIsgCZR3JmcyOoWXhAg.text: Argh. Such a hard place to review.I was debating on four stars but honestly, I don't think place lives up to the hype enough to run out and tell everybody to go...and here's why:The starter course was exceptionally forgettable. Something waldorf salady, some miniscule meats, and a good but marginally tasty baked brad thing appeared. I can't really say any of these options were stand out. My 20 pound steak was very disappointing..and I have yet to have a "great" steak here. What alarms me the most is that Tramshed ONLY serves steak and chicken as mains (I think they have fish but the restaurant concept is Steak and Chicken) and for that amount of focus, I don't accept a lack of panache.The chicken, however, was quite nice! Served at a stand, the quality was exceptional and worthwhile. Our "skinny" chips also had an extra level of awesome, but sadly this was due to some sage essence that only applied to the top level of the fries. Not bad, but not nearly the best I've had.I also tried the Hix Oyster stout/porter/whatever. It was nice, but not sure why it was "award" winning.Sadly, for as small as the menu was, I was not enthused enough to want to return. Sorry brah.

reI0YNkjmWH3nKAIidRxdQ.text: The best thin cut chips in London. This place might be known for its steak, but I snarfed down those chips like it was going out of style. The restaurant: Damien Hirst created The Cock and Bull piece specifically for the Tramshed, and is a great point of conversation for those new to the venue. People even refer to this restaurant as "the one with the cow and chicken in formaldehyde in the center of the room". The food: Known for its chicken and steaks, this restaurant serves a very limited menu, as it is best to do a couple items well then a lot so-so. If there are two or three of you it might be a good decision to order the largest steak and allow the waiter to carve it for you. Everyone can then pick there own pieces. If you order a steak, they do come a little more cooked than expected so perhaps a good idea is to order slightly rarer than you normally would.

tukpsYPUgrodopKkhPaHTg.text: To be honest with a menu like this, unless not a big meat eater, you can't go wrong. I like simple things, my history with men proves this, and this is as simple as it gets.Meat, red or white, wine, red or white and a side helpings of.....simple stuff!Boy do they do simple well, I could not stop eating. I got massive food envy when I saw each of my fellow diners food arrive and made sure I tried each and every meal. Its good swanky, its good service, its good food.....this equals a good night out.

1V1RuBb5ABkXNF6JdEtTDQ.text: Amazinng! We took our friend there for a surprise birthday meal and the staff were great, service was great. The food was incredible. I love the industrial feel to the restaurant and the art work is a great touch. Atmosphere was fun and lively, it's a great place to dine and drink with friends.

fvokCBT6BsTRVBwU5bb8Cg.text: Cool and trendy vibe. Recommend getting reservations. Went there to dinner with a friend and we shared the chicken which was AMAZING!! Loved the decor ;)

3dqzlBXirgLK4WnZE3Ur0w.text: Can't imagine chicken can be cooked this way and it's just super yummy! The restaurant is not just a dinning place but an art piece as well.

K4vysVl074UIvbebvB8ewg.text: Great food, service, wine and atmosphere!I went there with my parents on a Thursday night for my birthday celebration and had a lovely time.Even though my reservation were super last minute, all the staff treated us as if I had booked it a week in advance. We shared a delicious and juicy t-bone perfectly aged and prepared together with the wine suggested by the super nice Enrica!I only resent being a little rushed out. That is the only reason the place does not get 5 stars from me.

MwTA0UCXGfJA8YFM9GY6dQ.text: Had a disastrous lunch here midweek. We were after a quick lunch so my friend and I skipped the Steak and Whole Chicken choices and browsed the lunch time sandwich specials. There were three sandwiches on the menu, a chicken sandwich, a steak sandwich, and a 'Cock and Bull' sandwich.'The Cock and Bull' Sandwich appealed to us, and was described 'in italics' as a Chicken and Steak Sandwich. Which is surely what the name suggests for £9.50. Seemed like a good deal. So we decided we would order one of these to share. However once we ordered this Two Chicken and Bacon sandwiches appeared. So the kitchen made a mistake, but this wasn't my only gripe, I don't eat bacon, and nowhere on the menu does description for the chicken sandwich mention it is topped with bacon. Big mistake.. Had I even ordered this I would have had a problem...We asked the waiter to return the sandwiches, and the Manager came out and said there is no such thing as a chicken and steak sandwich, and that it is simply a chicken sandwich and a steak sandwich alongside it? Sounds like a load of Cock & Bull to me!Anyway no body was quite sure what was right, the waiter admitted the menu was misleading, a steak sandwich returned alongside a chicken sandwich which looked like it was one of the earlier ones that had been sitting under a heat lamp for 15 minutes. We ordered some brussel sprouts but they never arrived. The Sticky toffee pudding dessert sounded good but not £12.50 good, at that price it was more expensive than our main!We decided to get the bill to find that not only had they charged us for two separate sandwiches a 'steak sandwich' and a 'chicken sandwich', they had also included the brussel sprouts which had never arrived. We mentioned the mistake, they removed the brussel sprouts without even a hint of an apology for the fact that we didn't receive them.The whole reason we had ordered the 'Cock&Bull'  (which to clarify is a separate item listed below both the 'chicken sandwich', and the entirely separate item the 'steak sandwich') was the fact that it seemed like a great deal, Steak and Chicken in 'one' sandwich, and we were going to share this, we never realised we would be charged for two separate sandwiches. Cock & Bull is listed on the menu for £9.50.The Waiter hats off to him disappeared again to the Manager, and came back and said everything was on the house. Good resolution finally, but the numerous mistakes and confusion marred the visit. Shame as I had high hopes for Tramshed.

2HCxXvxb0_wJNecpn9knBQ.text: When I looked at the menu, I was not that inspired as it seemed quite simple. But they do simple...amazingly! Gorgeous steaks, lovely red wine, delicious crackling and croquettes, great and spacious atmosphere and attentive staff made for a really fun lunch.

Ev1Dry5Xc1hF97yMJVkZlg.text: Nice, big modern restaurant. All they do is chicken and steak. I ordered the steak, and it was cooked perfectly. The bearnaise sauce and the chips were good too. Apple pie for dessert was quite different than the American apple pie I'm used to. (It was round, and came with a tiny pitcher of cream). The starter of chicken liver pate and Yorkshire pudding was interesting. They also helped me pair my steak with an excellent red wine. Service people were lovely to chat to.In the men's bathroom, there's a screen displaying two naked lesbians caressing each other.Check it out.

2pgf0DQZr2oVkBzZnhW2uQ.text: Tramshed was unreal. I'm visiting my boyfriend from Manhattan and we were searching for dinner somewhere last night near his flat. We stumbled upon this on yelp and thought it'd be worth checking out. We arrived without a reservation and the hostess was sweet enough to seat us pretty much immediately at a table. To start, this place HUGE! They have it in a warehouse-like building with a ginormous cow  "floating" in the center of the restaurant.Started off with a couple of beers and the yorkshire pudding with whipped chicken livers (£3.95). We weren't sure what the yorkshire pudding was going to be like as we both have never tried it before... and then... out comes this puffy pastry-like bread with a side of the whipped chicken liver. It was seriously the perfect pairing - with the savory and creamy taste of the chicken liver spread and the crunchy crust from the pudding.. soo good. The boyfriend generally isn't even a fan of chicken liver and he was scraping the rest of the liver with the rest of the bread. So pretty much what I'm saying is.. GET THIS, you will not be disappointed.Based off the majority of the yelp reviews, it looked like the roast barn-reared indian rock chicken with stuffing and chips (£27.50 to share btn 2-3 ppl) was the thing to get. Literally between the time we were seated and the time we ordered, I think I saw 5 chickens come out for tables surrounding us. I don't normally like to order chicken at restaurants in fear that it'll be dry and flavorless. Not at this place!! The presentation was awesome as it's sitting in an upright position within a metal stand. The chicken itself was perfectly cooked and perfectly seasoned. It was sooo moist and tender! Honestly this is one of the best chicken dishes I've ever had. And that stuffing! My goodness that stuffing was amazing especially with the gravy topped over it. They even supplied us with a separate plate of stuffing at no extra charge. Oh and can't forget the chips!! (or as we Americans call it fries) The fries were soo good, not too "potato-y" (I made that up and if you don't know what I mean by that, I don't know what to tell you) and perfectly crispy. Overall experience was really good!! Very good service and the everything we ate was perfect. I'd definitely come back.

JWcqbcfB8bZnw7c2lNftBQ.text: Brilliant steaks made by a chiefcook that knows their way around a grill.Steaks were perfectly prepared. It's such a kindly place, awell-designed restaurant with the importance on the value of the food and thecontentment of the customer. I like the simply vibe of this place, and theirservice excellent.If I have time I would definitely return here every time I'mvacant.

fnHf33sJmD9rby_Yg0rIrA.text: They cook up an incredible steak, plus the ambiance of the Damien Hirst sculptures makes it that much cooler. And I should know because I'm an art critic: danielrolnik.comPS: They also have a vegetarian menu PPS: If you order the chicken don't be faint of heart, since it's brought to your table in a most unusual way :)

eEVVTmf168ZEq0fnHq6zxg.text: Very nice place with excellent service.  Huge, shareable, steak portions available.  I had the 250 G (about 9 ounces) sirloin, and it was cooked to perfection (medium rare).  Onion rings were top notch.  I had a mixed drink (vodka collins), and then had an iced coffee. The bar service was truly five star.Rather limited menu, but that's true for many steakhouses.Look forward to going back the next time I am in London!

unnFttb8xEsobIGdiz6Yrw.text: Chicken or Beef? You can't really go wrong!A simple menu with 4-5 different choices of either chicken or beef. I went a delicious beef salad which was cooked perfectly.Definitely going back for another visit as I have to try the whole chicken!

3ypV6nFVsqxFYsyWg-81Yw.text: I had a large 20 pax group booking for dinner on NYE and the whole experience was superb from the get go. The reservations/events team were friendly, responsive and accommodating. We arrived to a semi-private upstairs area perfect for group dining and shortly after were served a delicious seasonal feasting menu. Everything was standout and my fav was the yorkshire pudding with terrine. Great service on the night (sorry if we were a bit loud)! Highly recommend for groups!

syzFXfV-C4I2P6B0DJaL3w.text: Tramshed is a place I like to take visitors to. It captures the vibe of Shoreditch pretty well - industrial, modern, quirky, hipster, a bit pretentious... well you get it. You will find the interior interesting even if you don't have a taste for Damien Hirst or dead cows. Tramshed was a tramshed in the past - it once housed electricity generators for local trams, and was later converted into this chicken and steak restaurant by celebrity chef Mark Hix, who owns six other restaurants/bar in town.  And even if you don't like Damien Hirst, I am afraid it is pretty much in your face as the first thing that greets you when you step inside is a giant formaldehyde filled tank containing a chicken standing on top of a cow.  And yes! this is what you are going to eat tonight.  I quite like the humor actually, intended or untended.  There is also an art gallery in the basement where the restaurateur offers space for various artists to showcase their work.  Alright, onto the food.  I have been there on three separate occasions and have to say that execution is solid. When I say chicken and steak restaurant - that's the only choice you have in terms of mains.  I've had both.  The chicken is delicious albeit I believe some people will find its presentation abhorrent (look at the picture!)  The roasted skin was crispy and the meat succulent and moist, very flavorful and the skin smells nice.  (Just don't look at the dead chicken while you eat) For the steak, there is a choice between rib and sirloin.  Personally, I prefer the rib but try it out to see which one you like better.  On my last visit though, I had the sirloin and didn't think the quality of the meat is that great, doesn't taste very fresh.  The fries were really good though.  And that was just one visit, everything else has always been fantastic so I will give them benefit of the doubt. I also discovered that the shakes and desserts are to-die-for.  My favorite is the Eton Mess milkshake and the salted caramel fondue with marshmallows and donuts (order one to share).  Best marshmallows I had, so fluffy that I think maybe that's what a cloud will taste like.  Anyways, not a very healthy combination but who cares when you are at Tramshed.  Staff have always been attentive and funny, services efficient. I saw that they also offer an express lunch menu which is very good value.  I imagine if I work around Liverpool Street I will go all the time so if you happen to be there around lunch, try it as a taster.  Ideal place for group dinners, plus you can explore all the cool and hip bars and cafes in the area pre and post dinner.  I highly recommend.

kjAZ5Z9OQz0CeXzptkEXBA.text: Three Americans headed to Tramshed during our Thanksgiving in London - no turkey needed here!  The Porterhouse steak and roast chicken with stuffing were delicious, along with the abundance of chips and lettuce salad we added on.  I'd skip the starters and if you somehow have room, go with dessert or more wine instead.  This is a total dining experience yet centered on simple food.  Well done.

PkIZbnUtukSEhDwHzWSXLw.text: as it says above "meh". was wowed by the formaldehyde but thats pretty much where it ended.we'd booked for 9pm, 6 of us. didn't get seated until 10pm and it looked like the place had just opened even though that is clearly not the case. they did offer us some cheap starter to make up for it. sat in the booths which were good for the group. try get in there! I had the sirloin, £20 with fries, it was nice well cooked and tasty but a little cool. rest of the table ordered the steak salads and one went in for the whole chicken which came out limp, dry and not that warm either!we complained, didn't tip (which we explained to the server) and left pretty dissatisfied. luckily we were drunk by then. swerve.

QG7C1mVp_IkM82qMslFJyA.text: CLUCK CLUCK MOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO (that is all)Just kidding!... 4 stars goes to Tramshed. Hurrah. I had a jolly old time here for a spot of early Saturday evening dinner. Do you like Cow or Chicken? Well if so this is the place for you, because you ain't getting anything else.Initially I was likeWOOOOAHHHHH Freaky decor dudes!.... but in the end I loved staring at the giant Damian Hurst formaldehyde cow that was suspended over our heads. Especially because the cow had a hen perched on his back. What a Cock and Bull story indeed. I wanted to stroke my bovine friend. So cute.  Top marks to restaurant owner Mark Hix for for reflecting the menu in the art work. He also managed to get a giant Hurst cow and chicken cartoon work to hang at the back of the Tramshed. The building is also interesting too, built 110 years ago as an electricity generating station for trams. It's a great space but perhaps a bit cavernous and not giving the intimate feeling that diners might be after.And OMG! DRAMA MUCH .... other tables got served chickens diving into pools of potato fries. The bird had its legs akimbo with its claws intact sticking out into the air, and a knife up its derrière. It reminded me of a rubber chicken, even though rubber chickens are based on real chickens. I guess i have never really seen chicken with claws on when served.  WOWEEEEEEE... our table neighbours ordered the porterhouse to share. It's basically like a giant platter of steaky goodness, and obscenely huge for two peopleYUM YUM NOM NOM... My Chateaubriand steak served with fries and an array of sauces arrived and it was so delicious. I  think I could have eaten one of those aforementioned obscenely huge platters now .Lastly, MmmmmmmmmmmmMELTY... the credit crunch ice cream is the cheapest dessert on the menu but it would take some beating, so it is probably is the best too.  Caramel ice cream with chocolate and honeycomb crunch served with a huge of warm chocolate sauce to pour over. Food heaven.From the decor to simple menu - Tramshed was so much better and less gimmicky than I thought it would be.  Simple good food and not as hideously expensive as I expected. A glass of prosseco, steak with fries and dessert came to £32 each including service. Ignore the haters, aka the newspaper food reviewers, Tramshed do a good high quality no fuss dining experience but if you are after a more intimate and slow affair this probably isn't the place for you.

HHJNbCK6P41SyLvwprSwtg.text: Our favorite meal when we went to Shoreditch - We almost went back our last night!Order the whole chicken - you won't be disappointed... MAKE SURE you see the desert menu.

A-Mnt1Q4qKrmLfE3XRHGCg.text: Overpriced.  Ordered the chicken and bacon salad.  A few cubes of bacon, with some roasted chicken in a measly bit of field greens for 14 pounds.   The only dressing they had was a honey-mustard type.  Very bland, with minimal flavor.The staff was attentive and polite, but not very welcoming.  The protruding balls of a nosering, hanging out the nostrils of our waitress didn't help make any of the menu items more appetizing.  Overall, not very satisfying, for the palate or the wallet.

7f9zJLKoISTANzyuccf_ag.text: A Blind Date with Tramshed: Oh Tramshed, I'm just not that into you.I'm your jilted lover, left me wanting more, disappointed and blue. You swanky Hoxton minx  ....it's no surprise. Left me teary-eyed, hollow and with a lighter pocketbook 'stead of stars in my eyes. Excited for my date with the glamourous Restaurant, Tramshed. Heard so much good press, and that the venerable Hix is his dad. Well-heeled and connected, who would have expected the worst? His creative Black Sheep Uncle, Damien Hirst, Hooked up Tram with sweet art : chicken atop a cow, submerged over eyes. In a tank full of electric blue formaldehyde. But back to the matter at hand, din. Couldn't charm or disarm old Tram, the beginning of the end.Service was slow, waitstaff like robots, gormless No personality, no spark or individuality, helpful but not passionate, definite miss. Well, Fair Yelper, Tramshed was not terrible, just not a great date. One occasion that I do not wish to recreate. And I certainly don't mean to be brash,But Mr. Tramshed was a case of all style and no substance, class but mostly flash.  All brawn and no brains.Young Tram came 'atcha girl all wrong, though no doubt he's makin' it rain. Ambiance large, sterile, your style's not my thing, I said.No flair, no excitement, was awake but behind my eyes flat lined, brain dead.And seated at such a bad table through it all? Environs left me comatose, could have stared a hole in the wall. (Actually, I was most likely looking at the cartoon mural of Cow and Chicken).Or dithering in the (cool) bathrooms, on my iPhone, snickering, ...About how to get out of this terrible date!With my man Young Tram, but had to eat dinner before I could escape. Indulged in steak, and the chicken.Felt so indelicate, trying to pick at it. Since the chicken arrived, not properly filleted for gastronomic ease.But with the feet tied together, a little messy for a dining experience...jeez! Aware it speaks to the greater concept, but I felt it was quite lazy. And the sirloin appeared overcooked, a bit gray ...eeek! Chips were fine, the desserts fared the worst. American apple pie dry, chocolate cake too-beginning to end, this date was cursed.Oh I was hoping to get lucky in rest-romance but Trammy you flunked. No passing grade from me baby boy, afterwards I felt Kutcher-style punk'd.For us it just was not in the cards. Nope! The stars did not align by far. It's fair to say we got along, Although our chemistry was all wrong.So Tramshed I wish you the best. With many more suitable lady-diners, I am sure you will be blessed.But if I may be cheeky? Since I'm on a high,Doubt your future suitors can spit a rhyme quite as fly.

YKs-g0dwzI8UxnxUS9JGhg.text: Three of us ate steak sandwiches as a late lunch in an almost empty restaurant. The atmosphere and service were nice but the sanwich was nothing special and there were too much bread compared to the topping. The fries were very crispy and delicious thou!

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom

lqNIpYNUN4Rr6AlMubFCcA.text: Grand dining room however we enjoyed the aesthetics much more than the food.  Our waitress was not overly educated on the wine and steak cuts which meant she didn't really answer our questions correctly meaning we ended up with a cut which was not to our liking. The house red was very average however a little heavy on the pocket for what it was. One thing The Tramshed does have going for it is the sides and the starters, in particular the beer battered greens and the chicken and beef croquettes.   Good one off experience however much better steak available elsewhere for similar prices

L-Y01eO_DW7wmQJ5MI2YyA.text: One of my favourites restaurants in London, hands down.Mainly because it's the only restaurant in the world where I'd actually order chicken. And they let you carve it yourself if you ask nicely! and for a wannabe butcher like myself that was a dream!Tramshed gets five starts because of a few things: quality of meat, atmosphere, interior design, Damien Hirst, and wine. If the giant Damien Hirst Cow and Chicken in formaldehyde doesn't have an effect on you, I don't know what will.There's also a nice mezzanine that overlooks the restaurant, which we booked out one night which was great.My absolute favourite dish on the menu is the Yorkshire pudding with liver pate. Seriously, you need to try it.And although I did embarrass myself the first time by asking what the beautiful building used to be (errr a shed for trams madam?) I keep going back and loving it every time.

I2T8zQhKcpe4BaH0rhsLYA.text: Ohh tramshed! My wife and I were visiting London for about 5 days and we decided to stay in east London, shoreditch to be exact, which is a little edgier than what you would expect. We looked for popular dining experiences in the area and saw that tramshed was getting quite the buzz. So we decided to head there since it wasn't too far from the hotel. This place is sort of hidden in a side street so beware if you can't find it easily.The interiors are super rad. It is like an old building that was just gutted. 20 foot ceilings, real open plan layout. We ate sort of early, but on a Friday and we were able to get a table no problem before the rush.What this place is known for is chicken + beef + and chips. So we ordered their specialty, roasted full chicken and chips. That is exactly what you get, a huge beautiful roasted chicken perching like its on a beer can, with tons of fries (chips) around it. They come out with 4 different sauces, and you dig in! Very communal, conversational type eating.Was the chicken the best I had ever had? No. More like 3 star, but the overall experience led me to my 4 star review. We has delightful service worth noting.

3AOdfKB--fb2NIcv5wkZAw.text: I went here with some friends back in the fall, and WOW you should definitely come here hungry, because the portion sizes are tremendous. We ordered one whole chicken and one of the steak choices, plus a bunch of sides. The chicken comes with a generous helping of fries which we didn't know when we ordered fries separately.The giant cow in the formaldehyde box in the middle of the room is a little bit freaky, but you get over it pretty quickly when there's heaps of delicious meat, browned on the outside but pink all the way to the inside. I think we weirded out our server by asking him to leave the chicken neck and feet... (we're Asian, no kind of meat is too weird for us)Really tasty, and considering the amount of food they give you, quite a good deal. Bring a big group and a bigger appetite, and book one of the booths ahead of time!

pDXP9iLAoEWV27JgR8xLXg.text: Located in trendy Shoreditch, 5 minutes away from Old Street station, the Tramshed impresses with its cavernous yet cozy atmosphere, decorated with the famous "Cock and Bull" by Damien Hirst.There are only two options for main course in the menu: steak or chicken. Have them both. The French fries make for a terrific side with their unique flavor of chicken dressing but it will be the steak to make you eye-balls pop out.The staff are super friendly and the service is fast - we waited less than 5 minutes for our food. The desserts are just ridiculously good.This is not a budget place whatsoever. But its worth every penny you spend there.5 stars.

bLjXpgsAose4tS11xkR6VA.text: By far one of the best meals I've had in a long time. I came for lunch and went for one of their £10 specials, the cock n' bull sandwich. I also ended getting the pork crackling and apple sauce nibble/starter, which was amazing but make sure you've got teeth made out of steel as it was pretty hard to eat. The sandwich was made up of half chicken and half beef. Beef is cooked perfectly but you're aren't asked your preference of rare, medium/rare when you order, so could be an issue for a fussy eater. The chicken had to be the star, it had an amazing herbed crust and I wished the whole sandwich was chicken. You also get a huge bowl fries with it and some onion rings. So big I wish I hadn't had got the crackling. Atmosphere is great and I could see this place being a great venue to bring large groups. (Visit - 18/06/2015 Lunch)

x5OUlAhZPoXU_CjGMeIpiw.text: The way to serve the chicken in this place is hilarious! It seems starry in the fries :)Apart of this point the menu is not very extensive, to my mind the food is ok, if you don t expect too much.The restaurant is a huge building with a big tank in the middle of the room...inside there is a cow and a chicken in formol or something like that, it sounds disgusting but actually is pretty cool.It was an original experience, I will probably go again.

hdaDy7PaXS72fAfZhiw54w.text: I was happy to be flipping through one of my favorite travel magazines a few days ago, and see a picture of the chicken with legs that I came to realize is a unique dish among the London restaurant scene. While I didn't have that kind of chicken when I was at Tramshed for lunch, I did have a chance to try their chicken and beef. And dessert, but lets save the best for last. I had lunch at Tramshed a few weeks back on a Friday, and for a Friday lunchtime, it wasn't too busy at all. I always like being able to just walk in and be seated, and was even more pleased to be just by the giant formaldehyde chicken and cow centerpiece (though to be fair, it's hard to be far from it, even as big as tramshed is). While we caught up, we dined on the lunch sandwiches: mine just chicken, and his the half and half. The sandwich was a great size for lunch and the chips were really good. Not ready to end the lunch and feeling flush for having opted out of pints with lunch, we decided to split the salted caramel fondue, and I would trade beer for that dessert any day. With homemade marshmallows and some other dipping thing... Chocolate maybe? We put ourselves into a sugar coma on top of our protein coma. Tramshed is definitely cool, and reminds me of some of the really trendy places I've eaten in Chicago. Maybe that's not a compliment in true foodie circles, but it is coming from me. I'd love to come back and do dinner in a big way.

tFdydrHvhdIKUb6_BnLQEQ.text: We made reservations for Tramshed to follow up on a visit to Tate Modern. Definitely way too much Damien Hirst for a day... However, despite the unusual choice in decor, I had high hopes for the food!We ordered the starters for our table:- Yorkshire pudding with whipped duck liver- Ham hock with green beans and shallots- Panzanella This was probably the highlight of our meal. The starters come together as a set, and rather than per dish, the price is set by the size of your party (~£8/person). I really liked the ham hock and panzanella. The Yorkshire pudding was also really light and airy, which was great with the duck pate. For mains, we got a whole chicken for two, and steaks for everyone else. I was really excited to see the chicken dish, but though it looked interesting, the chicken was pretty dry. The steaks were also not very tender. Don't know what to say, but this was a big disappointment.Though the chicken and steak weren't great, I really liked the drinks we got. We had eton mess shakes, a cocktail, and a bottle of wine. I know this sounds like a strange combination, but the shake was reallllly good! We also tried their elderflower ice cream for dessert, which was also delicious! Not sure if I'd be back, but I do have to say we had a great time and the service was really great!

8DrM3HycDPpDIPuCfMPgNQ.text: I loved this place.  First of all, what a stunning space!  Gorgeous, high ceilings and a well-designed interior with a long bar.  We were able to book the same night at a shared table.I am a big fan of the focused food phenomenon (ala burger and lobster), so loved my choice of steak or chicken and just knew that they would execute well.The chicken was moist and flavorful, the steak grilled to perfection and the fries were infused with rosemary.  Yum!I'd go back in a heartbeat.

P4HDX_ZxM2Up4b8sPpMR7Q.text: I'll try to keep my review restricted because the Tramshed is as simple as it can get, yet so well executed.Went there for a birthday dinner, so there were 20 of us spread between two tables. The vast majority went for the chickens and so did I. You've probably seen them, legs up in the air and ready for everything. It was indeed, fantastic. Excellently cooked throughout, well spiced and with lots of chips to go with it. Plus the waiters cut it for you if you want but I'm a hands-on kind of person so I went face in and munched on every bit of it.I've had a sampling of salads and starters here and there, all were just as good and seemed to have been prepared carefully (minus the salmon that didn't live up to its exclusive Gravadlax declaration)Cocktails were nice - I had an Earl Grey something that came in a nice glass, looking as kisch as a fruit punch. Loved it though.The house wine was pretty good as well and matched the chicken - it was on the dry side (always a good sign).I'm already planning visit 2 and 3 and 4 and so on...

SVXcgh-SLbvI6uCUniX-BA.text: Decent food, a good-but-short beer list and fast service. Note I say fast and not good. There's fast and efficient and there's fast and trying to rush you. The steak was pretty good (though don't compare this to Hawksmoor etc) and the beer good too, but we didn't really have much time to enjoy them. We had someone coming to our table constantly asking us if we were done and wanted more, despite not even being half finished. It got pretty irritating and by the end of the meal I was quite glad to leave.Maybe the extra attention was because the staff wanted an excuse to look at the girl sitting on the next table to us.. She was pretty, and famous, I think..

457iAdxmIbCsXaauTNt5tQ.text: Popped in here without a reservation on a Sunday night, and they sat us at the bar. Although there were some two-person tables that did remain unfilled the entire evening, the bar was not a bad place at all, as the guy behind the bar was friendly and helpful. We started with the starters (Yorkshire pud with whipped cauliflower, ham hock with green beans and shallots, and something else), and also had the fried chicken hearts. For the main, we ordered the 500g steak to share for two plus chips and onion rings. The steak was a bit fattier than I would have liked, but cooked perfectly medium rare and was otherwise delish. The chips and onion rings were also good. Not too bad for the price.

1XhIRJQrCDowK6BiJyLKFQ.text: So I guess by now you know the menu choices are a mixed starter or no starter, the mains steak and chips or Chicken and chips and dessert ... Well the fact no one bothers to mention them tells you all you need to know about how interesting they are.Just to show my prejudices it is worth mentioning that I like this growing trend of having simple menus ... I like the idea of thinking what do I fancy eating and then going to the restaurant that does that ... Which is great as long as some form of meat is what one is looking for.So are the Steak and Chicken and chips worth eating?For the chicken there can be no question it is amongst the best roast Chicken in town and the Steak well it isn't Hawksmoor (and I am told Goodmans is also fantastic) so eating it here you have already chosen to eat at the second tier of steak restaurants and it is as good as that remark would make you think it is.As for the Tramshed venue well it is an enormous airy space dominated by an installation by Damien Hurst ... Although how much in put Damien had is open to question. I rather suspect it consisted of him looking at the cheque on offer and saying "Sure for that much I will put you in touch with my contractor and signing my name to anything". Broadly speaking it is one of those democratic open spaces that are all pale pine and visible cutlery draws.Soulless would be harsh but not unfair.Oh and did I mention the over priced cocktails and so so wine list?None the less I now have a location for when I fancy Chicken and chips to share with my friends ... I grant you I may not desire it as often as a Lobster or a green salad followed by steak and chips twice or even bbq but it is a worth addition.

gXq_Xgs3KgE2skO0Gu4xqQ.text: We went here on a bank holiday - attracted in part by the lunch offer and our friend's rave reviews on the chicken. I really LOVE the vibe here - the open plan seating and decor are a great add-on to any meal and the full service bar doesn't disappoint.  The food on the other hand wasn't really worth all the hype. My partner got the chicken salad, which was okay. My steak wasn't of the best quality and took about 56 chews to get down to manageable gulping (and this is coming from a fast eater!).  We probably won't look to come back here for a meal but it may be worth coming in for a round of drinks before a night out in Shoreditch.Service - Okay. Nothing to write home about. At the end of the meal we realised we were overcharged after looking at our bill a couple times - the dessert that was part of the set menu wasn't taken off. I can't really complain as we were anxious to get out and enjoy the day so didn't both mentioning it.

NJGQdhX4sRfgU8Dg8nzQbA.text: Who knew a lively restaurant like Tramshed existed on such a quiet street. A girlfriend and I stopped in on a Friday night and I was immediately amazed at the scene. It's a huge wide-open space, like a warehouse, and was very, very busy. We didn't have reservations, but they had room at the bar so we ended up sitting there. I ordered the Steak salad, which was fantastic. I really wanted to try some other things on the menu but I just couldn't manage it. Service was wonderful, and all the people behind the bar are quite friendly. The atmosphere is great, in fact, I think it would be a great place to host a birthday party!

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Salad
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Steak Salad

3UECpNTKOtXhK9wJOSnFlA.text: The ambiance and food presentation were fantastic, but the food itself and service are nothing to go out of your way for.I ordered the Gin Mare to drink which was described as a twist on a gin & tonic. The only "twist" being that they stuck a slice of mango in it and sprinkled pepper on top. We ordered the house chicken which was good but not as great as the chips. We only finished 2/3 of the shared dish so I asked for everything to be boxed up. When I wanted to eat the leftovers a few hours later, I realized the flippant waitress only boxed up the chicken and nothing else which was not at all what I requested. That was disappointing since the chicken was definitely not the best part of our meal. The waitress was already incredibly careless and disinterested throughout our dinner service but I didn't expect her to fail so spectacularly at a simple request she probably gets quite often. I hope the Tramshed retrains their waitstaff and refreshes their cocktail menu by my next visit.

0pCLhW5GtMWmAmccNAr9Pw.text: It's not every day you can dine underneath a giant vat of formaldehyde.  Of course inside this ginormous glass contraption is a chicken riding a cow. Bizarre, perhaps, though it actually makes a bit of sense when you see the menu...all there is on offer is chicken or steak. Even the appetizers (yorkshire pudding, cauliflower puree, and picked walnuts with broccoli) cannot be individually ordered, you must get all 3. Clearly, there is no quandary of excessive choice at Tramshed.I've been twice and the steak is good, not Hawksmoor good, but certainly among the finer pieces of meat you can get in Shoreditch. The steak was properly cooked (I asked for medium rare and got medium rare) and expertly sliced in front of you, though a bit fattier than I would have liked. Next time I will have to try the chicken, I hear great things---though it is off-putting that the legs are kept intact, a bit gross if you ask me.There is much to like at Tramshed apart from the chicken riding the cow (and the cool rear-wall cartoon painting of a chicken and cow as bffs)...service is friendly, the drinks are strong, and the food is rather tasty. The dining room is a massive cavernous space and can get quite bright (on those rare sunny london day)...it's a venue that's perfect for a large group of your carnivore friends as only chicken and steak are on offer.

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom

zrvzcv67eDLfuVPetueTtw.text: I had bookmarked this place so we decided to try it out  with no reservation on a Saturday night. Friendly welcome at the desk and they managed to squeeze us in sitting at the bar straightaway.The place itself is pretty big, packed and a bit of a destination place to go to. I like the semi industrial interior , the old tramshed. There's a huge Damian Hirst cow in a tank (God, yet another one) with a chicken on top of the cow. Oh, I get it... 'Cock and Bull'. Cleary they paid a lot for this centrepiece since it's the focal point of the restaurant. I veer between quite liking it and finding it irritating. At least it fit with the whole macho concept.Anyhow the food...It's the simple menu concept:Chicken or steak with one or two variants and sides.I ordered the spring chicken and chips for one and my partner a beef salad (probably not the best choice).The chicken came, famously, with feet attached sticking up in the air, rotisserie cooked and was great. Juicy and tender and with some stuffing inside and a tasty jus / gravy underneath, perfect for dipping the chips into. I quickly realised that there was no other way than to pull the tender chicken apart by hand bit by bit and savour the tasty meat and suck out the juices.Didn't have time to sample the desserts - looked good though.A select range of decent chilled beers on offer as well as wine and an interesting looking cocktail list which I will try next time.Service was excellent and friendly and hit just the right pitch.Good value too.

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Chicken for one
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Main dining area

cK6XBvuSvvX-TqqhjiRk2g.text: Open space that keeps it fresh and simple: chicken or steak. Food: 4 Service: 4 Atmosphere: 4Cost to worth it rating: 3Return worthiness: maybeHighlights- Atmosphere: large tall open wear house space with a large cow and chicken in a huge tank as the focal decor :-o- Chicken: brought to the table with both feet still intact for an unexpected but bold presentation. Was cooked perfectly and very tender- Steak: thick slices but quite tender as well with pure beef flavor- Wine: nice list and found a malbec we really liked- Cocktails: fun ones like a clover club with a tea twist, a flaming one, and one named shipfaced ;-)- Marshmallow fondue: fun with the spikey mountain formed marshmallows circling the delectable mild chocolate sauce. Was a big hit at the table and launched into another conversation about how we have smores in the US- Cheddar: the slice was quite nice in the cheese course- Cabbage: simple but cooked so the leaves were soft but not mooshy and seasoning was subtle but enough to not be blandLowlights- Bread that came with the cheese: I didn't care for the texture Solid spot I'd think about coming back to for the chicken and drinks.

YKkilIL63_-QL-kJAT1qSA.text: Let's start with the fact that there's a chicken riding a cow (ask one of the servers about the cow's name - apparently she had a lovely life) suspended in a massive tank of tranquil, turquoise formaldehyde... right in the centre of the dining room. I mean... how often do you get to have a meal whilst seated under gallons and gallons of preservative/carcinogen? It's truly a sight to behold.Beyond the kitchy décor, Tramshed, as a venue, is massively open and airy and somewhat reminiscent of a Victorian market hall. Offering both small two-tops and massive communal tables, it would be a decent spot for a casual dinner date or a group gathering. I think they may also have a private space in the back - we did see a bottle of Kahlúa and two glasses get whisked off in that general direction.I was quite grateful to end up being seated at the bar (as is my wont). Not only can you get the full dining menu there, it was a grand opportunity to watch the bartenders in action. Since I'd read about Tramshed in CLASS Magazine, I was really there to have a tipple or two. Full marks for a well-done negroni - it's the first time I can recall having one served with balled ice (a la certain sazeracs). The house cocktail I sampled later on, the Dizzee Marmalade featuring rye and tea ended up being a bit sweeter than I'd normally take my drinks, yet appreciably well-balanced. Whoever's behind their cocktail program has solid chops.And as far as the food goes, it's quite simple: chicken or steak (as indicated by their website URL) and various salads and sides. I especially liked the heritage tomato salad, but I'm a sucker for a simple, refreshing nightshade. Ask me about the heirloom tomato stand at a wedding I attended last year. I still can't get over it. And the chicken is truly an awe-inspiring visual when it's delivered. If you're fond of phoenix claws (fong dzua), you won't want to miss out. Crispy, flavourful skin coated tender, juicy meat which you carve yourself. Conveniently, a spoon is provided so you can drizzle drippings all over your meat as well. And as if that wasn't gluttonous enough, the bowl of chips that came with our bird was enough to defeat two hearty eaters.Whilst I'm not sure that I'd be able to have meat and potatoes served as simply as Tramshed's more than once or twice a month, I fully appreciate that it's a clever concept. I'd certainly take tourists here for some brilliant British fare. I -would- come back again and again for those bar bites and drinks, though. It'll be interesting to compare against Hawksmoor's new bar in Spitalfields - anyone want to research with me?

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Dining room
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Dirty gin martini

R3WAXwJGX_F3k7fTir20cA.text: It's a steakhouse so don't expect anything super innovative.  A large group of us went and I shared the Porterhouse with someone.  It was good (I think the sirloin was better) and was slightly overcooked (we ordered medium rare but it came medium).  That said, all the starters and sides were good.  Pepperoni went down a treat with everyone at the table as well as did the croquettes.  Polenta with mushrooms were flavourfull albeit small, considering what it was. I would have to say the highlight was the sauteed side of mushrooms.  If anything, this would be worth going back for. Chips were good and the way they should be  - crispy on the outside with just the right soft mushiness on the inside.Desserts were lackluster.  I tried the salted caramel fondue with marshmallows and donuts - it was ok.  Slightly cheesy presentation. flavours were standard but nothing to write home about.  Someone else had the apple pie which looked fine but again, nothing amazing.Decent wine list with some good lower priced options.  We had a Malbec for about £30/bottle.Overall, it was a good meal.  Amazing? No.  But consistently good, albeit quite pricey.  However, it was a great chance to see a Damien Hirst cow.  His artwork is overrated but I did see the wow factor about the cow.  How on earth did he do that?!?

tt6--6_UxCf4alD7zZCxqA.text: I have always wanted to try out the Tramshed since I work nearby, but haven't been due to the thought that it might cost an arm or a leg.  Well, recently I've discovered that they have a special Lunch menu.  They have a 2 course express lunch or alternatively you can also choose from a lunch special sandwich menu, where you can sample (and I do mean sample based on portion size) the 2 (only) 2 items that they do, chicken or steak, in sandwich form.Obviously if you do go for the lunch menu you won't be getting the full experience of the wow factor / presentation of the chicken / steak, you'll just have to watch and drool when other tables order it.  So we went for the cock and bull, which is a half chicken & half steak sandwich with fries on the side.  While the portion size was a bit on the small side, and the sandwich filling (the GOOD stuff) was somewhat little (here I mention the word sample again), the bits we did get were absolutely delicious... and has done its job perfectly of luring me back soon for a full meal.I'd highly recommend anyone who's unsure about this place to try out their lunch menu to 'test the water' or if you are a big chicken/steak fan.. dive right into the full menu.PS - Vege options available :)

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom

XnESjAe8JYiHxfjk0vVX6Q.text: I did not look at any Yelp pictures become coming hereWe ordered the chicken and I was quite surprised by the presentation of the roast chicken. Chicken feet propped in the air! I never imagined I would see chicken feet on a table outside of a Chinese restaurant. The chicken was okay and possibly a bit plain. It comes with a couple of gravy options to add some flavor. Some reviewers said their chicken was dry but ours was fine. The fries that come with the chicken were perfect though!We also tried the artichoke, bacon and soft cooked egg salad and some buttered winter greens. The portions for these items were quite small and the salad was excessively salty. The buttered winter greens looked quite sad. It was a few types of leaves and really just looked like someone washed a few pieces of lettuce and put them on a plate.

XejuBwg-7JUVj9zcbQiX6w.text: As a steak addict, this place is my drug dealer. Everything from the service, the wine, the atmosphere, the Damien Hirst cow in formaldehyde, the giant cow and chicken(cartoon vibes) and the main event itself, the steak. I would give this 6 stars if I could!

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Damien Hirst piece in Tramshed

MDqeM2U_ym46XCjEPg7p2A.text: The steak sandwich lunch special was awesome, but the dinner steak lacked any flavor

wefWspbtt2lt0qzEf9rLqg.text: We went here for dinner thus evening. A very impressive restaurant in a former rail shed.  Great industrial feel to the place.   The menu is short a d sweet with chicken. And beef and chicken as two options for a main course.    Overall I was disappointed.  The appetizers were cold when served and the main course came out 20 minutes later.  We ordered 2 bone I rib steaks medium rare.  They were both well done.  How can a place that specializes in beef not cook a steak correctly? ?  It took 10 minutes to get replacement steaks that were both rare to raw.   Back again and 15 mi it es later the steaks came out medium.   For 60 pounds this was unacceptable.    No apologies or reductions in the bill.  This place is an experience but maybe they are too busy to get the food right.   Look elsewhere or stick with the Chicken which was excellent.

VyDn3X5H4QLfdSnBEgrgkQ.text: Honestly I liked this place! it was easy to get reservations compared to a few months back when it was very new. I ordered the half chicken which feed both me and my friend for £15 which is a great deal plus we both ordered the yorshire pudding which I thought was lovely but was a little crisper  then I normally like my yorkshires. I honestly think this is a solid place for good roast chicken. the chicken comes with a really nice gravy. The only think i don't like about this place is that it is a bit of a trek from the overground or tube stations but hey its east London! I would love to come back and try it again. I think the prices are very reasonable on top of all that.

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Chicken liver pate and Yorkshire pudding
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Chicken leg ! Half chicken order
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Yorkshire pudding with chicken liver

8tnyvJ-Ajm9aJYmx1bJS6A.text: Such a pity. I tried to go here all weekend and finally got a time tonight Sunday. On arrival we were told there was no chicken whatsoever? There is only chicken and steak on the menu so how can a establishment of this calbre have no chicken very strange. Anyway we decided to stay and have the steak ( rib and a sirloin) pls a few side dishes and a bottle of wine! The wine was ok the steaks were poor and cold very sad. I like Hix other restaurants but I would not recommend this. The service was slow very slow. Am so disappointed

Xylb9n_xziNoBZ-w5UgkZw.text: Amazing food and the service was excellent. We went for my friends birthday and they even threw in a desert at the end with a candle for him. Try the Yorkshire puddings with pâté I will go again and again just to eat this!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom

SOMmT25BRInVpmA6d0_ynw.text: Went here with three work colleagues. All four of us ordered the same steak option except I ordered the 250g and not the 500g. Firstly, they brought me a 500g. I offered to keep it rather than have them send it back, mainly because they were so busy and I didn't want to wait for ages to receive a new order. Secondly, one of my colleagues had more fat than meat on his steak. Thirdly, they charged us for the 500g instead of my original order of 250g. All of the meat was tough and the staff were very rushed. This is a busy restaurant so don't expect too much personal service or character.

hfHqHaL6pV0oyo64LbQc0Q.text: Tramshed is a place you go to when you want to be impressed. Whether it's the Damien Hirst artwork or the tall ceilings, there are feelings of grandeur everywhere. That doesn't stop with the decor - the food is the same.I went with a group of about 10 coworkers celebrating a great year, and ordered one of two dishes - the porterhouse or the chicken. I went with the porterhouse but by the end of the meal I wished I had ordered the chicken.I had the the croquettes as a starter and it was a pretty solid choice - I would recommend it.The porterhouse came, and IT WAS HUGE! Served on a cutting board, I wasn't sure how my colleague and I were going to finish it. The meat was well cooked, but the fat had a crispy texture and tasted like no fat I've ever had before - it wasn't what I would call pleasant, though it wasn't non-pleasant either... it was just different. Unsure of what to make of it, I avoided as much of the fat as I could. The meat was a tad dry, but I'm being nit-picky.I tried another colleagues' chicken (which also has an amazing presentation), and that was spot on. Well cooked with good seasoning and moistness. The fries also soak up a bit of the chicken grease and tastes amazing. I helped myself to a bit more than I should have, but I knew that the chicken would have been the right choice for me - and not the porterhouse. Lesson learned. Next time, I'm going for the chicken.

OOo5d_x--J-kk_QbNjrwdw.text: I find myself liking Shoreditch more and more.  And I kinda hate that as I like to be indignant about hipsters and how overrated Shoreditch is (oh god, does that make me a hipster about hipsters?), but then I eat someplace awesome and I'm all, "dammit, Shoreditch... why you gotta make me like you?"  Tramshed is one of those places.At 5:30 on a Monday, the place was empty.  I mean totally void of anyone who wasn't an employee other than myself.  It was slowly filling up by the time Grant T. and I left at 7, and judging by the amount of staff, I imagine they get very busy very quickly in the evenings.  The decor is stark warehouse plus simple tables/chairs plus commissioned artwork.  Seriously, a commissioned Damien Hirst right in the middle of it all?  By the way, does anyone wonder where he gets his animals?  I'm not asking in a PETA sort of way so much as a curiosity sort of way.We had the following: Yorkshire pudding with pate, roasted chicken for sharing (which comes with fries), grilled mushrooms and onion rings.  I was happy with everything!  The chicken is a little drier than some of the other rotisserie joints in this city, but the seasoning and the gravy more than made up for that.  Not to mention that the seasoning from the chicken drips down onto the chips making them super delicious.  At £25 for the big chicken, which should actually feed about three people, it's not unreasonably priced.  Sides and apps are all about £5, so this is a very tasty meal that won't break the wallet.

gZtnU8UcXpV05QbRY1yxeg.text: "I like chicken, I like liver, Tramshed Tramshed please deliver!"I'd been avoiding Tramshed because I hear it gets busy. But we needed a place to grab a bite in the area (stupid Shoreditch) before going to have some Whisky, so I thought, "Why not?" So I booked, and I booked for fairly early.I think the booking probably wasn't necessary, when I arrived (half hour after my booking thanks to someone who needed emergency services on the Northern line) the place was empty except for Nava who had been waiting patiently for me.Anyway, we started out with a chicken shot and a beef shot (each). The chicken shot was okay, afterwards we told them maybe a bit of salt would help. The beef shot was awesome. Almost bloody Mary-like. I then had a grown-up iced tea which was pretty tasty.We had chicken liver pate on a Yorkshire pudding. Brilliant! The Yorkshire was super crispy and the pate was really delicious. We also had a sharing chicken served with amazing fries and sides of mushrooms (awesome) and onion rings (called fried onions on the menu). Everything was really tasty. The chicken was slightly dry, but the gravy was delicious and moistened it up a bit. But it was much tastier than other chicken venues I've been to where the chicken was moist, but bland. They also served everything with FOUR dipping sauces: Ketchup, mayonnaise, spicy English mustard and a mint pesto. Fun with dipping sauces. We were running late, so we skipped on dessert.The venue is cool. Ground floor toilets rock, and it's just a big warehousey place with awesome commissioned art pieces. (Cow and Chicken? AWESOMESAUCE!) There's also a "painting" in the men's toilet of two naked ladies. But it's not really a painting because at one point one woman moved! Clever bit of video work there.At one point Nava was concerned that we didn't fit in because we didn't have giant mustaches we could twirl. It's definitely a hipster sort of place, but I'm willing to forgive it due to delicious food. It's totally different and cool to like a place based on the how awesome the food is right, and not to like it just because it's cool to?I was tempted to add a fifth star because they use Ozone coffee. Anywhere that uses Ozone coffee deserves a higher rating in my opinion. So yeah, I'll be back. To try the beef. I hope it's as good as the chicken.

TTkOXYHurbPY7yllXDYK2g.text: I am giving Tramshed a 3.5 stars to be precise.Place: beautiful and spacious. Very relaxed and friendly. I especially like the cow and chicken theme throughout the place.Service: Just okay. Semi-friendly and Semi attentive. basically waitresses doing their basic job requirements.Food: I had the chicken with some side orders and a burger. The chicken part was just okay, the stuffing was amazing. The burger is just okay as well. The best part of the meal was frankly the fries as they were delicious and plenty!Price: We spent about £20 per person including drinks and tip. Our bellies were full so no complains there!I think I would be more impressed about Tramshed if I didn't read so much hype about it. I had a higher expectation before going in and my experience just didn't live up to that expectation.

u0bOpoa7jEJi1MiZ2_6zNg.text: I am sorry to be the guy to piss in the pool, but this place could really improve.  I live nearby, I like that it kind of up-markets Shoreditch (I am sure that this is not what most original shorditch pioneers want), but Tramshed really misses the mark... and I have really given it a chance.. 4 chances actually.I like that the chickens still have their feet, I love the physical space, the cow is cool but that's about where it ends.The servers all have a mild attitude that is just irritating... I almost wish it was a major attitude so that it would be novel or were actually nice / helpful.   The beer is below average.. you expect some well curated crafty selection but instead you get some rebranding thing with the owners name in huge capital letters.  And finally the food always underwhelms at an overwhelming price.  I ordered the 'rib' entrée this weekend and literally got 1 beef rib and a small pile of carrots in mayonnaise.I wish they just did it better and were less dicky.

rAfjyR_Dl9ng__g73z0J3w.text: I finally feel qualified to give a review on Tramshed. After 3 dining experiences. First: stopped in for lunch a few months ago. Had the chicken over salad + a latte to cap it. All in all, a solid lunch, likely 3.5 stars. No complaints. Second: An all-out steak fest with a gal pal Wednesday night no reservations 7pm, seated at the bar, hot French waiter, lots of red wine, onion rings, garlic mushrooms, the works. 5 stars. Not only no complaints, ONLY RAVES. Raves from the rooftop. Raves that are heard by the chicken and the cow riding in the aquarium du fromeldahyde. Third: Dinner with another couple, Friday night 9pm. Busy. Round of cocktails (Twitter & Biste recommended), all seems to be going well, then service goes way south, way fast. Food is lovely. Garlic mushrooms make a command appearance, whole chicken, whole steak, leeks (great!) plus salad. Great place to share the larger portions. Plus desserts. The apple pie is the clear winner, the dark chocolate mousse even a bit too rich for my blood -- the blood of a chocolate loving madame. 3 stars. Don't ask for an Irish coffee. Ever. So I think we even out at 4 stars, solid. It's a great place. You'll likely need a reservation any time you wish to come, maybe except lunch (where they have a good set menu if you like). The service can be hit or miss. The food is basic in variety, but done well. There are many variations on chicken and steak. The sides are top notch, those garlic mushrooms make me sing in my sleep. It's a big, impressive space. I'll come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Salmon and fennel
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Duck appetizer
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom

HViMwviPwLKRU83K-jzJ4g.text: Quick glance:+ great for large group+ sharing plates are delicious+ good cocktails- priceyFull review:Tramshed reminds me of a German beer hall, except the cock and bull in formaldehyde which is probably not a hallmark of any beer halls I've been. We came in as a group of 10, and the set up of the venue is perfect for large parties. As part of the few sharers we ordered to start, we had a beer stick each, which is like apepperami-looking beef jerkey, except it's soft and tasty. For mains, we had a meat sharing plate, a whole chicken, some ribs, and bits and bobs. The whole chicken was impressive, stuck on a plinth with its juices running down to the tray of fries, and I was tickled that they've kept the claws of the chicken. The prices are a bit on the high side (£30 for the whole chicken, £80 for a porterhouse to share) but the food is great and atmosphere fun, especially if you come in as a big group.

6SjtUw_8DpOJq4yptsuakA.text: The lukewarm food, poorly cooked steak (ordered medium, instead served black & blue, and £110 bill all could have easily been forgiven if not for the manager on duty.  After eating maybe 1/3 of the meal, we shrugged it off...every kitchen has a bad day, right? As we asked for the bill, mentioning the food was a little less than...the manager proceeded to launch a full fledged argument at the table, stating no one checks on guests because it's simply "not what we do here". Oh? Yet for a meal of 2 plates and cocktails there was an automatic service charge added with no hesitation. I've never left a restaurant who acted like they've done me a favor by letting me eat there.Rude, unprofessional and unreasonable at best. Save yourself and go to a Hawksmoor.

h2z_9hW8rZAaMKgvWNuk7Q.text: When you walk in, the first thing you see is the massive work of art by Damien Hirst.  A massive formaldehyde sculpture of a cow with a chicken on its back, in a holding tank on top of a massive stel pedestal in the middle of the restaurant.  AWESOME.On the staff's recommendation, I ordered the 1 kilogram Porterhouse.  1000g of monster steak comprised of the fillet and sirloin sitting each side of the bone.  For the non-metrics among you, that's 2.2 lbs or over 35 ounces!  Don't worry, I didn't tackle this beast alone.  I had the help of two friends, but chosen for their smaller appetites, it's all about strategy going into this!The steak was served a perfect, pink and juicy medium rare and carved at the table by a steady hand.  It arrived on a massive chopping board accompanied by fries and unlimited  béarnaise and mustard sauces.  The beef at Tramshed comes from Shorthorn, Hereford and Aberdeen Angus breeds, hand-picked from the Swainson House Farm in Lancashire as I mentioned earlier.  Despite the variety in breed, the one thing they all share is dry aging in a Himalayan salt chamber.  I don't know what that is, but it sounds magical, mystical, and fantastic.Now I'm primarily a ribeye man, going for that nice ribbon of fat in the middle cooked to a medium level to melt it smoothly into the surrounding meat.  But I gotta say, a Porterhouse is a perfect sharing cut at Tramshed.  The Fillet offers a less flavorful, but more melt-in-your-mouth texture and the sirloin packs a punch of flavor with its ribbon of fat and more bite.  When the judges scorecards were added up, the Sirloin portion prevailed as the favorite of the table.  At £75, the 1000g portion easily served three and I believe it's worth the price.  It's steak, unsullied by anything fancy, just straight to the point!  I go into some more detail on my beeffanatic.com site, but I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Entrance to Tramshed
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Beef art
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Carving up the 1kg Porterhouse at your table.

EOMS11Y7_ar0n-DKbpfdQw.text: Overpriced. Poor service. The Pit rib was dry and over salted. I've made better myself, and I cannot cook. This was truly disappointing. Come on Mark, sort it out. Spend less money the 90's art bollocks and more time on the food.

7m8BEp3WzlUJ2fpvKlSzdQ.text: Came here to get the roasted chicken but we also wanted to try other things.  Do exactly as I say below and you won't be sorry!For 2 people sharing:We ordered the Yorkshire Pudding, Cock n' Bull Croquettes, half roasted chicken, side salad, salt and vinegar onion rings and it was more than enough food. Yorkshire pudding - pate was whipped, smooth and fabulous with the popover bread.Croquettes - delicious with the mustardy/mayo sauce it came with. Half roasted chicken - very tasty and just enough for the both of us. We saw couples getting ONLY the whole roasted chicken and it was too much for them to finish. I personally like to have a variety of flavors so I was happy with our selection of dishes. The half portion and the whole portions both come with chips. Onion Rings - not usually a fan of onion rings because they usually end up soggy. These were so crispy even to the last bite. Very delicious, one of my favorites!Salad - came with a light mustard vinaigrette. I always need some greens or veggies with my meal.Didn't get dessert this time but I will definitely come back to try it.

Nu4WBx55hsvgz_AUHTXEQw.text: Absolutely amazing.  The food was excellent, the place is remarkable and the staff are brilliant.  The art is also pretty cool, cow and chicken at one end, a fermented cow in the middle and very cool décor.So we went for out 6 month anniversary and as I booked, I happened to mention this with the booking.  We ordered the salmon starts to share, a beautifully cooked steak which just melted in my mouth, and then came desert, the cheesecake... It arrived with 'happy anniversary' written round the plate in chocolate.  They went that extra mile and made the evening really special.I appreciate what the waitresses and kitchen staff did for us and we'll be back very soon - I'll try not to make it the year anniversary!

MAExYhMBk-KL9fOE2z0yTw.text: A good steak place, the meat was well cooked... Not specifically seasoned like some places but decent enough. Sides were standard with no real frills. Steak is served with a selection of mustard which I thought was a good touch.Beers are a bit on the pricey side bit the selection is ok. Venue is very spacious, there are lots of tables that can cater for up to 8 people and booths for a more intimate experience. The venue is impressive very spacious with art work from Damien Hurst (who is famous!!) Price ppintnia probably above what I would want to pay for the over all product but good for a treat.

1TgnueUhqbVIWIveV8dbsw.text: Not very impressed, if I judge this place by the quality of its dishes more than the fancy artwork the fuels the hype. I went for the sirloin and got a sirloin, feeling lonely, on a plate...but far far away from the quality I found in other meat restaurants. Place is huge, and those alcoves are cool for groups, but yeah...attention to details should be key, even more importantly when it comes to the dishes themselves. A good place to bring people you want to impress, more visually than through their tastebuds.

Q3wHS9-f2F1jQn_Tqjr82g.text: My friends and I can be real ay-hole, particularly one of my friends.  But at Tramshed, I felt like our inner ay-holy-ness was well received and OK.  The place serves beef sticks (a kind of beef jerkey for any Americans who are reading this) and chicken staked with claws hangin' all up IN YO FACE.  And lets not forget the giant formaldehyde' cow smack dab in the center of the joint.Let me break it down for you yo... order below and be happy as taffy... for 8 people, we had:Fun beef sticks Excellent Yorkshire pudding Excellent chickenSuperb porterhouse steakand some tasty croquettes!I am so excited that this was a Mark Hix spot... Mr. Hix is my favorite UK chef / restauranteur to-date and I recommend his restaurants to all my friends.

zLkmmd0ZCfPFmUNMkANjuw.text: Really really disappointing.Came here around March time. Table of 12 of us.We were assigned only one waiter for the entire table. The waiter was surly and rude. he was unfriendly and didn't explain the menu. he didn't introduce himself and generally looked annoyed when we asked for things like water for the table.Drinks were forgotten during the meal, or brought after an entire course was finished.We had the whole chicken with fries which wasn't piping hot and not worth the money.My dirty martini was great and even came with extra martini and extra olives.The manager had a sarcastic attitude when I asked for missing drinks.The steak was delicious but a rip-off.I would never come here again and I'll be advising friends against it too.Its a bit 'done' anyway. There are loads of more up-to-date restaurants in the area with great staff that actually care.

dAszIP8G8VuQFqAxM8vRig.text: I'm not a big fan of red meat so I got the vegetarian/fish menu, the food is good I got the curry sweet potato and the fish fingers. The atmosphere and decoration here goes on top of everything.One thing that got me a little annoyed is that they try to hard to be cool, the waitress was rude and she kept making b*tch faces to me and my friend when we where paying.This restaurant is more for the experience than the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom

UePyG4SSV8If_WGUl47KpA.text: Located in the heart of Shoreditch, this place is huge in comparison to most restaurants in the area.  It's a converted railway arch or depot or something as it has super high ceilings.For starters, we got the Yorkshire pudding and liver.  The Yorkshire pudding came out a bit burned unfortunately (see photos).  The liver, however, was more like a smooth pate and it was very tasty, well flavoured. Also got the beet root side which was good. They're serious about meat.  I got the sirloin and my friend got the rib. Both great and cooked well to spec eg medium rare. We topped it off with dessert which was fantastic though expensive at £14.50 - Salted caramel fondue with churros (or what seemed to be?) and marshmallows. The Salted caramel was amazing. Really tasty with the churros.  It was too sweet however with the marshmallows.  I'd recommend asking to substitute the marshmallows with more churros.A great meal, good location and great for a couple people or groups.

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Salted caramel fondue
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Iceberg lettuce side with blue cheese and walnuts
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Side of mushrooms

34PPmWtoZ4KVkKCgZeWR3g.text: The environment is very nice. Big with a high ceiling, cool decoration. The food was excellent. We had a steak and it was very well made and tasty. Dessert was also great (ice cream with chocolate). I am giving them a 4 because I thought the place was a bit too noisy (there were kids screaming a lot).

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom

RUB-g9VqGxdHfW68whf24Q.text: Typical Shoreditch, this high-end joint in an industrial setting. The act doesn't get stale though, as long as quality of products and service prevail.Tramshed is another one of Mark Hix's projects. At the core it's all about the products, which is good. There is some choice for starters, but mains can be either chicken or beef. Very good chicken. Very good beef.Dry-aged (Himalayan salt-chamber you instantly guessed of course). And we all presume a Josper oven is used to give the chicken the crisp and the beef the crust.At one end of the room, a big tank filled with formaldehyde contains a young cow with a rooster on its head. Very live-like. Bit sad. Guilt disappears with every single chew.Pleasant service. Real mayonaise. Underwhelming chips. Who cares.I'm a fan...

AZ1g-kIl0YoG0SaMQ3bKmA.text: Doesn't live up to any hype I'm afraid. The fillet steak salad was very disappointing - no flavour at all to the meat. I tried the whole roast chicken others in my group had and this was tasty but nothing special. The salted caramel fondue and cheesecake both lacked any subtlety. My partner said his chicken burger was basic and the house wine was poor but still pricey. Hugely overpriced for what it is.

GaYjrAnXxp_3cmonmhFcEw.text: We stumbled across Tramshed as we wasted time for our Callooh Callay res. It looked really cool and had that big bar which is hard to find in London so we plopped down for a couple glasses of wine and split cock n bull croquettes (tasty, sauce with some kick), chicken drumsticks (good fry job) and shaved cauliflower (kind of boring, too creamy a sauce) all in the £6-7 range. Sorry to have missed the Yoorkshire pudding tho. Lots of cool stuff in the Hoxton Sq. area but glad we found this spot.

gUqjJlMV5oW1dQP_JDdHQQ.text: Amazing art but the feet on the chicken are an acquired taste. I suggest that clients are told that the chicken is served "on the bone" with the feet before finalizing their order. Amazing ambience and fantastic service from Will and Sarah! Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Chicken on the bone

Qse7teqYrLh0ULiOx_iHOA.text: The Tram Express lunch was...not very express. We were there over an hour and had to get dessert to take away. So if you need to be in and out and back to the office in an hour, I would not recommend trying to get lunch here.That criticism aside, the food was pretty good - nice steak salad and chicken burger (2 courses at £9.95). The chicken burger came with an interesting lemony (one friend thought borderline lemon curd-ish) sauce and delicious chips. The apple pie dessert (which you could have instead of the starter) looked good and was also quite big.There is a really ugly painting at one end of the restaurant that upset me. Also, it was really cold. I liked the freestanding sinks in the loos though.

tXIfOro35OkauW0DHhq9UA.text: Good food, cool atmosphere, friendly service. It's annoying to be charged $1.30 for tap water though.

36v1UocpLOBLT8LIvL3dcA.text: We came in with a group of eight and were delighted by both the food and the service. Place is a little tight and if you're not into some loud decorations and a vibrant ambience, maybe not the place for you, but for us it was exactly what we wanted.Went with the whole fried chicken and stuffing and was not disappointed. Chicken was cooked perfectly and stuffing was luscious and delicious. Could have actually used a bit more of it.Burger with egg was also well regarded from the other side of the table - definitely couldn't get a bite of that.They were super nice and even had the bar make some iced tea for me - not a London traditional beverage.

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Entire fried chicken with stuffing. So good.
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. A pretty delicious burger.

WMfboSksNH-f_-HtCNLrMw.text: This place is tired, and needs a re-vamp. The service as appalling, and the food is merely fine. Firstly, our steak came out came out not as we asked - rare instead of medium rare. Instead of being apologetic, they were annoyed when it was sent back. After our mains, they then offered and served us another bottle of wine. We were then promptly asked us to vacate the table 10 minutes later. When we said we'd actually like to stay and finish the wine, and have a desert, I was harassed by a rude door-woman who was trying to 'prove to me' that they only took 2 hour reservations. Why serve us a bottle of wine, if you wanted the table back within 10 minutes? Horrible experience.

Dvo5F8q90ieKLMlB8DJjAQ.text: There's a real full-sized cow, with a rooster on its back, suspended above the dining room. If this is what you're looking for in a dining experience, then this Hix restaurant will deliver for you.Don't worry; the cow and rooster aren't alive. It's a Damien Hirst piece, a fitting ode to this steak and chicken restaurant. It seems morbid, but it's really awesome (kind of like their chicken presentation.)This is one of three memorable things about this restaurant that will stick with me. Another being the chicken itself.I love Yorkshire pudding and ordered theirs served with the whipped chicken livers. When it arrived, it looked really really dark for Yorkshire pudding - and was impressively shaped like a hatbox. Once I broke  it open, it was fine -- just crisper than I'm used to. To accompany the chicken, we had the mushrooms and the creamed spinach. My guy loved the spinach but I found both too salty for me. Memorable thing #2 arrived with the sides: the chicken.It's served whole and upside down on a spit, its little feet still intact and looking DELICIOUS. The server cuts off the feet and I volunteer my plate up. Great flavoring (salty) and crispy! I had to tap out early on the rest of chicken and french fries due to the salt but what I ate was good. Then comes memorable thing #3. The server brings out a steak to carve at the table next to us. He's slicing the steak and whoopsie daisy! the steak piece falls on the floor. Not missing a beat, the floor manager arrives and calmly says, "Another steak will be brought out to you shortly. Medium-rare, right?" It was pretty classy how it was handled; no panic, no fingerpointing at the server -- so great. The pair at the table are not bothered in the slightest. A second steak arrives and though they fight the good fight, soon the gentleman said to us, "We are stuffed! Would you like this piece of steak?" He hands my husband a huge chunk of steak, which my husband tries to politely decline, but I can see his mouth watering. The man insists and we end up talking with them throughout the meal. A common theme in London, which I sorely miss already.

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Damien Hirst piece. Cow and rooster
