Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Chicken!
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Mushrooms and creamed spinach

OTLihRHuimTn_gY-vtJvMw.text: This restaurant has been on my list pretty much since I moved to London, but somehow I never got around to it. I just knew about the formaldehyde cow, which people have mentioned in conversations about Damien Hirst. But when a friend was visiting and said he wanted steak, this was on our shortlist and we booked it after finding that every Hawksmoor in town was full. It's a very airy, sprawling space,  almost a warehouse feel. We have one of the booths to the side of the restaurant, which sat the 5 of us comfortably and could have even fit in a few more people. We ordered some starters, including the Korean fried chicken, beefballs, croquettes, and the Yorkshire pudding with whipped chicken livers. The meat ones were rather forgettable, but the Yorkshire pudding was super interesting and would recommend. For the mains, we shared the Shoreditch strip joint, which was possibly the largest piece of meat I have ever been served. It's 1.4kg of pure meat, for 5-6 to share, and we definitely had leftovers. It comes with chips and salad, so we were basically all set. They had a confusing system of where they told us the meat usually comes out one grade rarer than what you ordered, so we went for medium. When we got it, there was definitely a spectrum among the different parts of the piece from medium rare to medium, so hopefully among a group you can sort out your various preferences. On our way out, we saw some very good looking grilled whole chicken, so that also seems to be a popular dish. The food here isn't anything fancy, but they do the classics well.

7yWknQPbj-2hX38qiZgZxQ.text: You guys is that REALLY a real cow and chicken in the middle of the restaurant? Like, for real? So when you walk in the entire place is impressive. It's a massive modernized farm looking room with a huge giant aquarium looking thing with a cow and chicken. BUT IS IT REAL? I don't know. Probably. Whatever. So, we came here with friends because they wanted to and yes we're vegetarian so sadly I can only speak for the vegetarian food, but HEY! We were pretty impressed that they offered another menu for us. But you have to ask for it. The butternut squash and sweet potato curry is very good with warm basmati rice and fried onions. Very good. The fries are also addicting and they give you multiple dipping options (but the portions are small so ask for extra!). Husband got the aubergine burger which was also nice. All of our friends go the steak which they said was good. The service was excellent and very understanding because we had one person in the party who kept disappearing so it was throwing off the ordering process. They were really accommodating though and awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Aubergine burger
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Butternut squash and sweet potato curry
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. The chocolate fondu dessert

FR3qM9diJlVOh-Ov4FWErg.text: Hype about the artwork? I get it, all themed, the huge piece of "Cow and chicken" the nutty, 90s? cartoon network show, I don't get so much, but sitting under the huge formaldehyde pickled cow and chicken Damien Hirst? I do, though I think this looks much better in the day or early evening when the light is better. It wasn't very busy when we came, and huge and spacious, which is refreshing for shoreditch, you get the choice of cow, or chicken, but I'm guessing you got that already, but the menu is full enough. The chips are well seasoned, as is the meat, and although I have had better, it was still pretty damn good taste wise, and cooked perfectly. Maybe we came on a good day? I don't know.Our waitress was fab, heard me panicking about my phone and offered to charge it, was quick and polite.I think this place is best for a big late lunch, meat and a big bottle of reasonable red with an old friend you can share with (the fondue, do it), and not feel judged when you eat a whole chicken face planting a bowl of chips in one sitting.

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Fondue of yum yums marshmallows and toffee/caramel/gooey/sticky/sweet awesome
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Pickled coowwwww

ccVtqJa8uRUMGPgZEC2KjA.text: I came here with a dozen colleagues and ALL of us were thoroughly satisfied with our experience from start to finish. Incredible, albeit unique, atmosphere. We all managed a long table together and were in the very capable hands of a very charming waiter named Charlie, who was able to keep up with us all night! We got the Yorkshire pudding with whipped chicken liver, the Beefballs & the Cock 'n' Bull croquettes. Although all were good, the popular vote went to the Yorkshire pudding/chicken liver combo - just the right amount of lightness in the pudding and the whipped liver. Amazing, just order it.Then, as a group, we ordered 2 of the Indian Rock chickens with chips and 2 orders of the sirloin. Somehow, I worried there wouldn't be enough chips for the table and Charlie assured me there would be plenty. I don't know why I ever doubted him, though perhaps he should have mentioned he would bring 2 additional BOWLS of chips on the side.Warning: the chicken is not for the faint of heart - it comes to the table looking slightly monstrous, with it's feet sticking up. Also, don't forget about the stuffing inside - delicious. And the steak. Oh, that steak. Cooked to medium to appease everyone at the table, it was still incredibly moist, perfectly charred on the outside... just so incredible. Somehow, after all that, we still had room for dessert. So, we turned to the salted caramel fondue, which is served with marshmallows and doughnuts. This, perhaps obviously, is very, VERY sweet. I like my desserts, but I found this to be just a little TOO sweet for me. And through it all, Charlie was attentive AND entertaining - I made sure to let the manager know as well. The art, as I'm sure you've already read about/seen pictures of, is different. Divisive, perhaps, and YES IT'S REAL, but certainly sparks a conversation.

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Oh, this steak
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Salted caramel fondue
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. The chicken!

qgPmgI6Bf4UXWK_w27GwKg.text: Having come here for dinner on an occasion for a work meeting, I really enjoyed the experience having not known what to expect! We firstly had some lovely Portuguese red wine which was lovely and smooth and very drinkable! In regards to the food, the 4 of us had 2 large steaks between us, which when described to us I thought "We probably need one each really"...however was I sooo wrong :)They were huge and we just about got through them both between us, with sides on top too. I enjoyed it immensely and the artwork and large cow hovering above  just added to a very different experience. I would love to go back again - very soon :)

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Amazing steak! Shared between two of us!
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Some excellent side orders to go with our steak!
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Excellent Portuguese red wine!

rwpEowtF8PFuMyeRidSd4g.text: The chicken sandwich (I put an egg on it) with chips was upscale comfort food to say the least. The honeycomb dessert was honeycomb pieces sprinkled on top of chocolate mousse. Perfect finish.. If you're drawn here for the artwork, it's big enough that it doesn't really matter where you are seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Honeycomb dessert and the hirst installation...its a warehouse style building

OMqNFQ_k70XQwA9Q8i96hg.text: Very cool space in a fun neighborhood. Cock and bull sculpture is a wonderful centerpiece in this restaurant. I split the big ribeye with a colleague, it was excellent. We all had Yorkshire pudding and chicken livers. That was delightful. I wish they had a better beer selection but the food was very good, the service was solid and the space is great. I highly recommend this spot for a casual steak in London.

RV89jmPyKKw7CXyhE_TgLA.text: Nice selection on the lunch menu for £9.95.  The wait staff was attentive and the background music just at the right volume so you could enjoy it and still have a conversation.  Would definitely recommend.

7L5mhS4t8S0Vs4kwoPjUhA.text: This place has not changed since I last came 4 years ago.The set up is fun - with the infamous cow in the middle of a very large room. The menu has not changed either - great chicken and steak....Clearly a victim of their success :1. They did not put any thinking into how to (slightly) evolve their offering for returning customers and the changing Shoreditch food scene2. The service was simply awful despite the restaurant being at 20% capacity - it was slow, we had to ask for our drinks 3 times, the waiter advised us to take a dish that..... was not on the menu anymore etc.Again - the food was good as always but they are clearly sitting on their laurels !

iiRq_xCTOqH0khNq46HxYA.text: For starters we went with the Cock 'n' bull croquettes- made with a ground beef and chicken mixture with mashed potato and deep fried and Beefballs 'McIlhenny.'  Our favorite was definitely the Beefballs, a MUST! Whether you live in London or just passing through, Tramshed is one stop you have to make. I promise it will be an unforgettable meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. London, England

xBdU6ZsTO1g9Pne6j7QqZQ.text: Im gonna go with a 3/5 on this, plus a solid ten stars to my waiter who was HOT AS FUCK and i should have let him touch a boob because now im regretting it Big table, we tried everything. Not a massive fan of the appetizers, especially the pork scratchings. The beef we shared was ok, a tad hard, not the softest cut... the chicken however was the stuff of jizz, i mean ARE YOU KIDDING it was delicious. The fries too. Oh and the bathrooms are great, took some sick selfies yo

d2zkREJn8MtzOV6J-2xBxw.text: In general I prefer to avoid giving bad reviews but I was actually quite disappointed with Tramshed. While the food was reasonably good, the service was very poor which is the primary reason for dropping to 2 stars. Service was very slow, a member of my party waited 20 minutes for a Mojito, and the two other cocktails we ordered took far longer than normal. Our server (Matas) had absolutely dreadful customer service skills. We were quite reasonably made aware our table would be required at 9.30 for another booking - we arrived at 7pm for a 7.30 reservation so as to ensure we weren't delayed. Now, our server came and asked if we were ready to order after about 2 minutes of being sat at the table - we asked for "another couple of minutes" to look over the menus. He didn't revisit the table for 20 minutes. The consistent poor service thoughout the meal meant when we got round to our final course Matas started to rush us. Though not in a remotely polite way, he was blunt and unapologetic for his shoddy service. This meant the end of our meal with very rushed and not our fault and actually made it quite unlikely that any of our party will return again. The food was good in general, probably 3.5-4/5 stars, though the service left us with a bad view of our Tramshed experience which brought my overall review rating down to 2 stars. While our table was at peak time on a Saturday evening, I don't think it's unreasonable to expect a certain level of customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Rib on the bone, very nice steak - cooked exactly as requested. Reasonable value too
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Old Fashioned with Rye Whiskey - weak taste, not enough bitters used
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Salted caramel fondue, it's not as deep as you might think! Probably need more sauce for the amount of bites you get

O3odfK3Mu6wskfi92vBkqQ.text: A very cool and weird place.  We sat at the bar and had the chicken and steak.  It seemed like chicken was the thing to get as everyone was ordering it and it was quite good.  They give you plenty of dipping sauces for it as well which was nice.  Great presentation of food and a unique place to stop and eat if you are in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Cow in water? Why? Not sure
Photo of Tramshed - London, United Kingdom. Dipping sauces for chicken

JInCk7fSRlX7vXo13139LQ.text: I've gotta say that this place really didn't give me much of a wow experience, ok  it looks cool but from my time spent here with friends and colleagues it all just seemed a bit meh. Nothing was particularly bad but nothing particularly good - here's my roundup. * The rib eye steak at £22 was just not that great, I've had much much better steaks at lower prices and it was just lacking taste. * The onion rings were so crispy they were almost inedible. * The spinach side was so creamy and had an overpowering taste of something that didn't work (I want to say nutmeg...maybe??) that it was just a bit over the top. * Beer selection was very poor - the 'Hix Pale Ale' was basically old man bitter at £6.50 a bottle which is stupidly overpriced and tasted flat... I can understand Mark Hix wanting to get his name on a beer if it's his restaurant but surely put it on something decent!I had high hopes but unfortunately didn't see much to want to come back which is a shame as I know some friends have rated it highly.

r1gd4WogKZOVTpQsuUsj2Q.text: LOVE this place. Its my go-to when I'm visiting London. The food is delicious, the bar menu is great, and the staff is as friendly as they can be. Oh did I mention the giant cow and chicken in the center of the restaurant? Its such a fun vibe. I usually go for lunch.

RZvR6xmsEHnZVkT0sVJ2FQ.text: Interesting atmosphere but not sure I will go again...The food looked good and tasted average.  The service was fairly good but it is pricy for what you get.  I also feel they lack variety on the menu. If you are an art lover who loves meat in its raw sense, you would love this place.

n3s8NxPo0c_NTbW0lNniUA.text: Really cool place, great neighborhood as well. I didn't get the crazy chicken dish but saw it at other tables, very funny!Food was good, nothing amazing. Great venue though.

8fhHiol719JpoXx2pSXFhw.text: Great restaurant!   I ordered the chicken, which was moist and delicious.  Great presentation too, chicken was head down with its feet up in the air (yes attached).  The place is in a large open building with subway tile from the floor to ceiling.   Artwork from famous London artist's is scattered throughout.  Quite a trendy place.  Patrons' avg age is late twenties.

jeKn7tzYRltonaYzj3p15g.text: Three nights ago I visited Mark Hix's latest restaurant, The Tramshed, which opened on 23rd May in Shoreditch. It was buzzing as I entered, a large warehouse-esque space with double volume walls crowned with a pitched green roof. Hix himself explained: "I just wanted it to be very, very simple ... The expanse of this space really lent itself to simple dining." Exactly. It's that successful recipe of mixing design and food, a polygamous marriage between architecture, creativity and simplicity in taste (using both meanings of the word). The restaurant orchestrates a great vibe in this way, not to mention with the added quirkiness of the large Damien Hirst sculpture 'Cock and Bull' (a cow and cockerel preserved in a steel and glass tank of formaldehyde) that watches over diners from its 4 metre high pedestal at the centre of the room.The menu really is simple: either steak or chicken. There are also three starters, which come together at £8 per head. We opted to try these: Yorkshire Pudding with Whipped Chicken Livers, Ham Hock with Peas and Goat's Curd with Beetroot Puré and Walnuts. The Whipped Chicken Livers was a delicious mousse, like a smooth and velvety pâté infused with flavour. The Yorkshire Pudding would have been better heated, instead it was cold and spongy without a tantalising crisp to its golden exterior. The Ham Hock was a great little dish, with the meat being tender and complimenting its bed of green peas mixed with mustard. The Goat's Curd was thick and creamy, but the beetroot beneath it was merely a pool of cold soup. Its texture was too thin, meaning the third dimension of taste added by the toasted walnuts was lost in the dish, which did not hold well together.As for mains, two of us opted for the whole Roast Wooley Park Farm Free-range Chicken and Chips (£25.00), one of us chose the Glenarm Sirloin Steak and Chips (£20 for 250g) and another went for the Chicken Salad (£13.50). Unfortunately, the latter never came. It did show up on the bill, however, and once we pointed this out our server was duly apologetic and offered to make our desserts complimentary. Minus this glitch, the service was excellent, very friendly and swift - especially for a week-young restaurant.Back to the food - the chicken comes positioned vertically for ease of carving and, of course, theatricality. It was quite a sight to behold these poultry being ferried to and fro, legs up in the air like cancan dancers. The waitress offered to carve it for us, as shown in the photo below. The seasoning was delicious, especially the gravy juice at the bottom of the plate. The breast itself was not the most moist chicken breast I have had, although it is often drier that the leg, but the quality of the meat was there for tasting. The leg was the most enjoyable part and extremely supple. The unique presentation of the vertical chicken also allows for a 360 attack, permitting everyone on the table to dig in and also enabling you to get to every nook and cranny. The skin on the 'underside' of the bird, for example, is one of my favourite bits and it was extremely easy to access, while tasting just as crispy, thick and seasoning-encrusted as it should be. Since the whole chicken serves up to 3 people, my companion who ordered the MIA Chicken Salad was thankfully well and truly stuffed by the end of our meal.I am told the steak was not the tenderest in the history of steak tasting. It was, however, cooked as requested and retained a good meaty flavour. Both dishes come with chips in the form of French fries. If I'm being pedantic, which of course I am - especially with chips - they were not hot enough upon arriving to the table. Temperature is crucial when it comes to fries! They did taste good, but for personal preference they could also have been slightly more cooked to give at least a hint of crunch to their exterior.We ordered both available side dishes: the Garden Salad (£4.25), which was fantastically fresh with a really tasty dressing, and the Suffolk Crown Asparagus (£5.25), which were skilfully cooked to retain a gentle crunch and were a really great accompaniment to the meats.Merging visual culture and culinary delights in one space works wonderfully here and, as I iterated at the beginning of this piece, it is a harmonious marriage that translates into a guaranteed great night of food, drink and socialising. The concept is focused, the dishes are great, the service is efficient, the place is cool. The future is bright for The Tramshed.

A9gJmuwFparfOR6l-DC_pQ.text: Super cool place! I really enjoyed the decor. The food was pretty good but didn't blow me away. I would definitely come back here again but probably with friends who are visiting the city.

UCpy8c-FVYTi_yRnEneQXg.text: i am giving this a five star without any doubt... amazing chicken to be shared, moist and tasty.... staff a little too cool for school... can sense the hipster vibe from outside the door... but god that chicken.... and the marshmallow and chocolate dessert... unreal... reasonable prices... great chips... visit...

oOUIljR9uALxgQXhAM8tvA.text: Solid food and excellent service from the staff. Make sure you get reservations head of time cause the place gets packed. The restaurant is tucked away in one of the side streets in Shore Ditch, but easy enough to find.Drinks are good and the starters are yummy. If you can, get the 3 for 10 pound deal. We got the Yorkshire pudding, onions rings, and the croquettes. They were yummy, but they weren't piping hot. Seemed like they had all the starters on standby, but aside from that...very tasty.For two people, you can just order the 500g sirloin and it comes with fries (chips). We got a side of the minted peas. Very nice and refreshing! The steak was good, but I think the winning dish would be the roasted chicken. It's a show stopper when the waiters wall by with it.Again, the staff was very attentive and great dining experience. Don't forget to admire the cow in the tank right above the restaurant.

8tceuvmaEZp6gIXRMyEjsA.text: Come on an expense account.  Stay for the chicken. The room is great.  Mr Hix knows how to arrange a space and make people feel welcome.  We were there on a Wednesday night and the place was heaving.  Drinks were a little more creative than I expected.  I ordered a perfect Manhattan up, which came down with a round ice cube in it.  I was in the mood so didn't comment.  It was nice as a drink, but not what I ordered.  Starters are utterly useless.  Don't waste your money.  Seriously, they are one of the great rip offs in London restaurants.  An utter sham.   The starters consist of a trio for £7.50 per person.  The potted shrimp were pedestrian.  The Yorkshire pudding was fine but bland with an unidentifiable goop on the side.  The salad was nothing special and small.  A total waste.The steak was cooked pretty well.  Not to NY standards in terms of char, and the meat itself was good not outstanding.  It of course was very expensive.  The chicken though was the highlight.  Really, really, really good.  I can't recall a better roast chicken.  And the chips were grand and overflowing.  Well done.(BTW, a great but bit odd water policy of discouraging bottles in favour of a filtered pitcher.  I can live with that.)  We didn't have pud.  Luckily a friend picked up the bill.  To be honest, I'd go back for takeaway chicken.  I wouldn't go back except on an expense account.

2ObqezPl4I65SyVrIqT4eg.text: The tramshed house red, was a pleasant surprise! And the steak was perfectly medium rare. Maybe a bit pricey, but i guess thats to be expected when they have a damian hurst hanging over the dining area.

we_eCKDr2B1_xPpnb1aXvw.text: Great food and cool atmosphere. A must try.

oqw_j0xd0eb4LQeyUZGNoA.text: Bland chicken, seriously over hyped!The steak was tastleless again. Chips were ok, parsley stuffing was dry and the gravy still lacked. I was sooo looking forward to this and went despite the poor reviews and only to be met with disappointment. the best bit was by far and indeed the saving grace of evening: Apple and gooseberry pie with custard. And even there they managed to skrimp on the custard. Fear not, you can ask for more, as I did, and I got another thimble sized serving again.

is3egSXsjJnlPl_N7mXyhg.text: Great idea. Simple menu and fantastic food. Chicken has such a great flavour, just mind the feet!
